intro: Cynanchum surrubriflorum, commonly known as the red-flowered milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually red or orange in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access underground water.
